articleContent.title: Chord: Minor Major 7th in F (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Minor Major 7th in F (Shape: A)

## Brief Presentation
The Minor Major 7th chord in F (played in the A shape) is a rich and complex chord that adds a jazzy and soulful flavor to music. It consists of the notes F, Ab, C, and E. This chord contains the minor triad (F minor) along with the major 7th interval (E), creating a unique and somewhat mysterious sound.

## Notes and Intervals
- F (Root)
- Ab (Minor 3rd)
- C (Perfect 5th)
- E (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor Major 7th chord is commonly found in jazz, soul, and R&B genres. It adds a sophisticated and emotive quality to music, often creating a sense of tension and resolution. This chord can be used to evoke complex emotions and add depth to compositions.

## Songs
Here are three songs that use the Minor Major 7th chord in F (Shape: A):
1. "Misty" by Erroll Garner
2. "Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones
3. "So What" by Miles Davis
